title: Noam Chomsky speaks about humanity's "Prospects for Survival"
description:
Renowned linguist and intellectual Noam Chomsky gave a speech at the UMass Mullins Center on Thursday night. 

Chomsky's speech was part of a celebration for the inaugural opening of Crotty Hall, the new home of the UMass Amherst Department of Economics. 

Chomsky is the author of hundreds of essays and books and has been an established social critic for decades. His work touches on a vast array of topics, including U.S. foreign policy, the Israeli occupation of Palestine, the dangers of nuclear proliferation and climate change and many other issues.
